Debt Manager Options
Select the debts that you want to payoff first. Typically you should pay the highest interest rates first.
Specify the date that you want to start your payoff schedule.
Select the Extra Payment that you want to apply toward the accelerated payments.
Using the minimum payment, which is typically for interest only, will apply the difference between the regular payment and the minimum payment of each debt towards the total extra payment.
You may optionally specify a percentage to be set aside out of the total extra payment. This will slow down your payoff process, but it wll also save some funds for emergency situations.
Specify an interest rate to use for calculating earned interest on your savings account. The savings account funds should be easily accessible for emergency situations.
Specify a Return On Investment (ROI) percentage to use for calculating earnings after your debts are paid off. Your monthly debt payment will be invested at the specified compounding interest rate.
